data.title: Love Actually | Full Movie | Movies Anywhere
data.meta_description: Purchase Love Actually on digital and stream instantly or download offline. "Get ready for fun!" (Leah Rozen, People) with the "feel good movie of the year!" (Clay Smith, Access Hollywood) Love Actually is the ultimate romantic comedy from the makers of Bridget Jones's Diary and Notting Hill. Funny, irresistible and heartwarming, an all-star cast (Hugh Grant, Liam Neeson, Colin Firth and Emma Thompson, to name a few!) will take you on a breathtaking tour of love's delightful twists and turns. Fall under the spell of Love Actually and share the laughs and charm again and again.
data.text:
Set to the backdrop of Christmas, Love Actually finds believability in the unbelievable, crafting an environment where anything can happen and the greatest risks should be taken.

January 12, 2024

The film is all but stolen... by Bill Nighy as a washed up rock star goofing his way through his holiday TV and radio appearances as his seasonal song climbs the charts.

January 6, 2024

... Curtis and company remind us that love, actually, is everywhere no matter the time of year, period, or place. That’s what helps make it a staple watch this and any other time of year.

December 14, 2023

A cringe 10 for the price of one bulk holiday sale of the most well-worn rom-com tropes.

December 11, 2023

The film simply has an attractive charm about it that pulls you in and keeps you interested.

November 21, 2023

Richard Curtis’ Love Actually claims the prize of being the “ultimate romantic comedy” not through daring or originality, but by covering every cliché imaginable offered by the genre, and doing so with style.

August 28, 2023

...while Curtis clearly connects more with some stories than others, the best bits are genuinely classics...

December 27, 2021

The work is lopsided and misshapen, not like life, but a poor, contrived, somewhat disoriented impression of life.

February 15, 2021

A load of sickeningly twee nonsense inflated, bizarrely, into some kind of totemic Christmas film that only humbugs suggest might not just be rubbish.

January 31, 2021
